snippet: Severe weather hit South Asia in recent days, but the reason for the landslide, in which 158 people were feared dead, was unclear even four days later.
abstract: Reason for landslide following severe downpour in western India, in which 158 people are feared dead, remains unclear; some officials suggest deforestation of land was culprit, while others say it was a natural disaster.

byline.contributor: Bhadra Sharma contributed reporting from Katmandu, Nepal, and Gardiner Harris from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: Severe weather hit South Asia in recent days, but the reason for the landslide, in which 158 people were feared dead, was unclear even four days later.

headline.main: Otherworldly Downpour Preceded Landslide in India
headline.print_headline: Otherworldly Downpour Preceded Landslide in India
